events.title: Epstein's conversation with R. Couri Hay
events.description: Epstein had a conversation with publicist R. Couri Hay about improving his reputation, asserting his conviction did not constitute pedophilia and that his victims were 'tweens and teens'.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively investigating Epstein in July 2019, seeking to interview two sisters who previously worked with him and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters.
Publicist R. Couri Hay was referenced in New York Times stories as having recent conversations with Epstein about his reputation and prior conduct.
Epstein told Hay that his conviction did not constitute pedophilia and that the girls he had sex with were 'tweens and teens'.
Investigators prepared a subpoena for Hay in case he declined to be interviewed informally.
The correspondence shows coordination between NYPD and FBI on child exploitation investigations related to Epstein.
